org.jcatapult.mvc.validation
Interface Validator<T extends Annotation>

All Known Implementing Classes:
RequiredValidator
public interface Validator<T extends Annotation>

This interface defines a validator.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Method Summary
 boolean validate(T annotation, Object container, Object value)
          Validates the given value against the given annotation.
 

Method Detail

validate

boolean validate(T annotation,
                 Object container,
                 Object value)
Validates the given value against the given annotation.

Parameters:
annotation - The annotation that is associated with this validator and that was placed on a bean property or field.
container - This is the Object that contains the bean property or field being validated. This is useful when a specific validation is dependent on other properties of an Object. For example, an address might have special validator on the state property that ensures the state is only specified for countries that have states.
value - The bean property or field value.
Returns:
True if the validation passes, false otherwise.
